original_context: Feeling left behind by others' success; need a mindset shift and connection.\
generated_post_text:
if you’re tired of feeling like everyone’s life is moving faster than yours - read this:

your breakthrough starts where your comparison ends.

we live in a constant highlight reel.
new internships. new startups. new wins.

and you scroll through thinking:
“why not me?”
“what am i doing wrong?”
“how are they always winning?”

i used to think the same way.
every time someone around me leveled up, it felt like i was falling behind.
but that mindset is poison - because when you’re focused on their lane, you’ll miss your own.

once i stopped comparing and started learning from those wins instead, things changed fast.
you realize success isn’t a race - it’s proximity.
the more you’re around driven, positive people, the more your own energy shifts.
you start believing it’s possible for you too.

so here’s the truth:
𝘺𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘴𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘰𝘯 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘴𝘵𝘰𝘱 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘦𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘯𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨.

if you want help surrounding yourself with people who lift you up, not drain you - you can find them on Boardy.

because when you spend enough time around winners,
it stops feeling impossible to win too.\

original_context: Personal reflection on almost giving up on dreams and finding support to continue.
generated_post_text:
i’ve almost given up on my dream more times than I can count

it all started with a dream

a dream to push myself in this game of life

a dream that tried to hide itself from me when it seemed so far away

a dream that that tried to fade when times got tough

it really just is you against you at the end of the day

how far could I go if…

if what?

i will go far in life

and so will you

so bridge that connection, with yourself and with others

there’s other people here to support your dream and hear your voice

for me, finding the right platforms and people made all the difference

Boardy was one of those platforms where I met individuals with the same drive, the same vision, and the same desire to grow

it wasn’t just about networking

it was about building the kind of connections that accelerate your journey, that bring you closer to your dream

no dream is ever too big, you got this\

original_context: Reflection on feeling stuck a year ago and the key to getting inspired now.\
generated_post_text:
💭 A year ago, I felt stuck.
I could barely land an internship.
Didn’t know what direction I wanted to take my life.
And honestly… spent more time scrolling LinkedIn than actually doing anything about it.

Fast forward a year — I’m still just as confused
But along the way, I’ve been lucky enough to do some incredible internships, and more importantly, meet incredible people who changed how I think, work, and dream.

Here’s the thing — if you want to stop feeling jealous of people on your feed and start being inspired by them…
start meeting them.
Talk to them.
Hear their stories firsthand.

That’s exactly what I’m doing now with Boardy — a place where you can connect with the most inspiring people around the world, have real conversations, and start building your own community. DM Boardy on Linkedin to get started!
You never know what one conversation might spark.🔥\

original_context: Reflection on the stress of Waterloo ECE 'Hell Week' midterms and the realization that consistent studying is the key to exponential growth.\
generated_post_text:
My best friends are balding.

Are they really? Yes. (ECE midterms are lethal, (unless you genuinely love it or are insanely cracked, don’t take it). I think it’s the water + stress to be honest.

Stress? Oh yeah.

Waterloo Engineering had it’s infamous “Hell Week”, a week full of back-to-back midterms.

Was it hard? Yeah!
Did we get through it? Yeah!

High stakes, and no breaks.

That’s what it was. It felt like no matter how much I studied, no matter how good or poor an exam went, you had to just forget about it, and move on to the next one.

But what did I learn?
Consistently studying is the way to do well on these exams.

Cramming can scrape a pass, but in this week, I learned so much that if I studied this hard every week, the growth and learning is what is truly is exponential.

This is why I will start studying hard much more consistently. Why? Because that anxiety and panic of LEARNING content the day before an exam is a feeling I never want to have again.\
visual_context: Placeholder: Image related to a student studying late, or a visual representation of stress/academic pressure.\

original_context: Analogy between a friend's mass DM dating strategy and the 'ship first, refine later' approach to product development, emphasizing speed over perfection.\
generated_post_text:
my friend wanted a girlfriend. 
so instead of building himself and waiting for the right one, 
he took action and mass DM'd a bunch of girls. 
no testing, just raw market execution. 

and guess what? 
he found the love of his life. 

instead of waiting around, he got in a relationship, 
and then became a good boyfriend

speed over perfection 101. 
welcome to 𝘏𝘰𝘸 𝘵𝘰 𝘉𝘶𝘪𝘭𝘥 𝘈 𝘗𝘳𝘰𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘵 𝘍𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘚𝘤𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘤𝘩! 

most people refine all the details, spend weeks planning, 
fixing their logo, and focus on adding one more feature. 

others. they just ship. 

Facebook launched with typos in their app. 

Remember: speed gets you feedback, perfection just delays. 

So send that DM. Ship that item. 
Learn, Adapt, Repeat. 

You can always fix those bugs later, but you can't fix waiting forever for the perfect moment, because that moment will never come. 

If you want to make the most out of your time, and meet like-minded people, use Boardy, stop waiting for the perfect moment, and network NOW.\
visual_context: Placeholder: Image of a fast-moving, slightly messy whiteboard or a visual of two overlapping gears (speed vs. perfection).\

original_context: Using a personal story of being ghosted due to a long text to illustrate the core product principle of simplicity, arguing that complexity is why most products fail.\
generated_post_text:
i got ghosted for sending a long paragraph ... 
then i double texted. 
yet another airball. 

welcome to part 2 of 𝘏𝘰𝘸 𝘵𝘰 𝘉𝘶𝘪𝘭𝘥 𝘢 𝘗𝘳𝘰𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘵 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘚𝘤𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘤𝘩!
today's customer need: 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗶𝘁𝘆

i got ghosted not because i said the wrong thing,
 but because i said 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝗺𝘂𝗰𝗵.

this same concept applies to products. 
most don't fail because they are bad. 
most fail because users can't figure them out. 

remember: if your product makes people think too much, they'll ghost it too. (people are lazy)

Apple made $5 𝑡𝑟𝑖𝑙𝑙𝑖𝑜𝑛 off this concept. 
When flip phones had 12 buttons,
they launched one with 𝟯 - power, volume, and home. 

we all know how that went ... 

so next time your brainstorming product ideas, 
once you find a problem, 
find the 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. 
often times, this is the most effective, while users also love it. 

Boardy is doing the same thing. You message it what you need, and it connects you to the right person. simplistic peak. 

(this is why nonchalantness is so hyped as well - cause they don't do 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝗺𝘂𝗰𝗵)

#product #growth #simple #design #apple #Boardy
visual_context: Placeholder: Minimalist image, possibly a stylized iPhone with only 3 visible buttons to represent simplicity.\
